parse.title: Landscape at Auvers in the Rain

text.*:
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (August 2015) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
Landscape at Auvers in the Rain
Artist Vincent van Gogh
Year 1890
Medium Oil on canvas
Dimensions 50 cm × 100 cm (19.685 in × 39.3701 in)
Location National Museum of Art, Cardiff, Wales

Landscape at Auvers in the Rain is an oil on canvas by the Dutch post-impressionist painter Vincent van Gogh. Painted in July, 1890, and completed just 3 days before his death, it depicts a landscape at Auvers-sur-Oise, where van Gogh spent the last years of his life. The depiction of the rain with dark, diagonal lines are considered[according to whom?] to be inspired by Japanese art.[citation needed] This was one of Van Gogh's last paintings before his death.
